alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 20 at 4:14PM AKDT until May 21 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT SATURDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MATANUSKA VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a Red Flag Warning for hot, dry, and windy conditions, which is in effect until 10 PM AKDT Saturday. * WINDS...Southeast winds up to 15 mph with gusts up to 20 mph. * TIMING...Now through 10 PM this evening; Noon to 10 PM Saturday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...65 to 75 degrees. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast winds are expected to remain gusty especially in and around Palmer through around 10 PM this evening. Winds subside overnight with some RH recovery. Winds are expected to become gusty out of the southeast again Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening with low min RH values. Winds subside Saturday evening with some RH recovery overnight. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or occurring now, or will shortly. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public.
